intro: Microlicia altoparaisensis, commonly known as the Paraiso microlicia, is a tropical shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
